channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: Your Mouse DPI Specs Don't Matter Anymore
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.description: There's enough DPI to go around.
item.content:encoded: When it comes to mice—gaming models in particular—there are few specifications thrown around as much as DPI or Dots Per Inch. Bigger, simple numbers have always been a marketer's dream, but now with mice boasting silly numbers like 12,000 or 30,000 DPI, mouse makers have truly lost the plot.

item.title: Ubuntu 25.10 Questing Quokka Is Now in Beta Testing
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: Some default apps are changing thanks to GNOME 49.
item.content:encoded: Canonical, the company behind the popular Ubuntu Linux distribution, has officially released the beta version of Ubuntu 25.10, codenamed "Questing Quokka". This is a big deal because it's the last interim release before the next long-term support version, which is slated for April 2026.

item.title: How to Use the WRAPCOLS and WRAPROWS Functions in Microsoft Excel
item.dc:creator: Tony Phillips
item.description: Turn a single Excel column or row into a 2D array.
item.content:encoded: Microsoft Excel's WRAPCOLS and WRAPROWS functions let you reshape a single row or column of data into a two-dimensional array. This is useful for restructuring raw data, making large datasets easier to read, or creating groups with specific numerical parameters.

item.title: Notion’s 3.0 Update Wants to Help You With Project Management
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.content:encoded: Notion just launched Notion 3.0, which the company is calling the biggest update ever for its popular productivity app. This update will let Notion work with you to make better notes and give you an agent to help you create better spaces.

item.title: Tor-based Tails Linux 7.0 Has Arrived: Here's What's New
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: This version is changing a lot, and the requirements are slightly higher.
item.content:encoded: Tails 7.0 is here, and it's a huge update that brings a ton of new features and improvements to the privacy-focused operating system. The new version is the first to be based on Debian 13 (Trixie) and GNOME 48 (Bengaluru), which means there are new versions of almost all the included applications.

item.title: This Is Why I Use Static IP Addresses With Home Assistant
item.dc:creator: Adam Davidson
item.description: One small change can help to keep your smart home connected.
item.content:encoded: The majority of the time, we have no idea what the IP addresses of our devices are. You don't need to know that your phone has an IP address of 192.168.1.12 on your local network in order to use it. Your router takes care of assigning and reassigning IP addresses in the background, and you're not even aware that it's happening.

item.title: How to Validate Your Data With Statistical Tests in Python
item.dc:creator: David Delony
item.description: Put your data to the test!
item.content:encoded: Having data is only half the battle. How do you know your data actually means something? With some simple Python code, you can quickly check if differences in data are actually significant.

item.title: How to Install the Google Play Store on an Amazon Fire Tablet
item.dc:creator: Joe Fedewa
item.description: You're not stuck with the Amazon App Store.
item.content:encoded: Amazon Fire Tablets restrict you to the Amazon Appstore, but they run Fire OS, a custom version of Android. That means you can install Google's Play Store to gain access to millions of Android apps and games, including Google apps like Gmail, Chrome, Google Maps, and more.

item.title: I Kicked My Loot Addiction, But Borderlands 4 Is Dragging Me Back
item.dc:creator: Maximilian Padilla-Rodriguez
item.description: Loot games are fairly common, but few do it as well as Borderlands.
item.content:encoded: Nothing in gaming has ever been as addictive as loot grinding, and there's no better proof of that than the Borderlands series. Each new game has delivered more guns than the last, always with more variety and wilder gimmicks than you'll find in any other series.
